what_is_lesbian.name: What is Lesbian?
what_is_lesbian.value: Lesbian is a term used to describe women who are romantically and/or sexually attracted to other women. This identity acknowledges the diverse experiences of women who love women, embracing a range of relationships and identities.

history.name: History
history.value: The term "lesbian" originates from the Greek island of Lesbos, home to the poet Sappho, who expressed affection for women in her works. Over time, "lesbian" evolved to specifically describe women attracted to women. It's a significant part of LGBTQ+ history and culture, reflecting the journey and struggles of women who love women.

flag.name: The Flag
flag.value: The first documented lesbian pride flag was designed by graphic designer Sean Campbell in 1999 and published in a 2000s issue of the Palm Springs Gay and Lesbian Times, the "Labrys Lesbian Flag" <:_:1115866300858761236>. The "Lipstick Lesbian Flag" <:_:1115867721737977877> was the first design of the now more modern flag in 2010 and later had the "Pink Flag" <:_:1115867480649379840> in 2015. These flags adopted horizontal stripes harking to the Rainbow Pride Flag designed by Gilbert Baker but in a gradient of pink and white. Finally, in 2018, a woman on Tumblr named Emily Gwen posted her idea for the lesbian flag called the "Sunset Lesbian Flag" <:_:1115868994746974320>, which has 7 stripes and was later simplified to 5, aka now the "Lesbian Pride Flag" <:_:1108868440363642930>. ([Source](https://flagsforgood.com/blogs/news/history-of-the-lesbian-flag))
